intro: Calchas scutellarioides var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaved calchas, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Acanthaceae family. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
